intro: Ribes brachybotrys, commonly known as the short-stalked gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to North America. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of shrubs and vines commonly found in temperate regions. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features compound leaves with three to five leaflets. Its small, yellowish-green flowers appear in clusters and are followed by edible, red berries that ripen in late summer. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
